page.title: 20THE MEDIEVAL COINS
page.content: THE MEDIEVAL COINS TOLD BY NEIL APPLEBY WRITTEN BY HELEN WILLOWS. ONE DAY TWO MEN CAME TO APPLEBY'S FARM .THEY WERE TREASURE HUNTERS.THEY WANTED TO TAKE THEIR METAL DETECTORS INTO OUR FIELD WHICH HAD JUST BEEN PLOUGHED.MR.APPLEBY SAID YES.THE MEN SAID IF WE FIND ANYTHING WE WILL GIVE IT TO YOU.LATER ON THAT DAY THERE WAS A KNOCK AT THE DOOR.IT WAS THE TWO MEN .THEY HAD TWO COINS.THE COINS WERE FROM 1312.THEY WERE EDWARD III SILVER GROATS.WE DO NOT KNOW IF THE COINS ARE VALUABLE OR NOT.WE FOUND THAT EDWARD III SUCCESSFULLY REISSUED THE GROAT. THE WAR SAW THE CULT OF CHIVALRY BLOSSOM.THE ORDER OF THE GARTER REMAINS.THIS WAS THE TIME WHEN WAR WITH FRANCE TO RECOVER AQUIAINE WAS WAGED WITH OUT PAUSE.THE LONG BOW WAS THE DOMINANT WEAPON AT THIS TIME.
